title: Schneider Electric Transforms Building Environment Optimization with New Additions to Connected Room Solution - PR Newswire
summary: Schneider Electric introduces new products, SpaceLogic RP-V and Insight Sensor, which provide quality ventilation based on tenant needs and measured occupancy, aiming to optimize energy use and reduce costs for businesses.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article describes innovations that promote demand-driven ventilation and increase energy efficiency, focusing on improving environmental sustainability by reducing energy consumption and enhancing occupant experience.
business_innovation: TRUE - Schneider Electric's new products, SpaceLogic RP-V and Insight Sensor, represent a business innovation as they are new services introduced to the market with the aim of optimizing energy efficiency and enhancing tenant experience.
green_product: TRUE - SpaceLogic RP-V and Insight Sensor are designed to reduce energy consumption, enhance occupant comfort, and provide demand-driven ventilation, aligning with the definition of green products that aim to minimize environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE - The development of demand-driven ventilation methods utilizing SpaceLogic RP-V and Insight Sensor to optimize energy use and provide comfortable environments aligns with the definition of green processes that aim to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 334510 - Electromedical and Electrotherapeutic Apparatus Manufacturing, 335310 - Electrical Equipment Manufacturing, 334220 - Radio and Television Broadcasting and Wireless Communications Equipment Manufacturing, 334513 - Instruments and Related Products Manufacturing for Measuring, Displaying, and Controlling Industrial Process Variables
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it focuses on genuine environmental benefits and advancements in energy efficiency and occupant comfort.

title: Equipmake introduces Ampere-220 e-axle with a 3D-printed electric motor - Charged EVs - Charged EVs
summary: Equipmake has developed a compact, lightweight, high-power electric drive system called Ampere-220 e-axle for manufacturers of high-performance EVs. The system offers 220 kW peak power, a peak power density of 11 kW per kg, and can be configured as a twin-motor or single-motor application.
green_innovation: TRUE - This innovation is a green innovation as it contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing carbon emissions through the development of a high-power electric drive system for electric vehicles.
business_innovation: TRUE - This innovation qualifies as a business innovation as it involves the development of a new electric drive system for high-performance EVs, differing significantly from previous products.
green_product: TRUE - The Ampere-220 e-axle system is a green product as it is designed to significantly reduce environmental impact through its high-power density and lightweight construction for electric vehicles.
green_process: TRUE - The development of the Ampere-220 e-axle system involves green processes such as additive manufacturing and the use of environmentally friendly materials to minimize environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 336310 - Motor Vehicle Gasoline Engine and Engine Parts Manufacturing, 336350 - Motor Vehicle Transmission and Power Train Parts Manufacturing, 335312 - Motor and Generator Manufacturing, 336111 - Automobile Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE - The article text does not exhibit greenwashing as it accurately portrays the features and capabilities of the Ampere-220 e-axle system without making false or misleading environmental claims.
